parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To bind, put in chains, tie together. From a derivative of desmeo; to be a binder, i.e. To enchain, to tie on.
Heavy, weighty, burdensome, lit. and met; violent, oppressive. From the same as baros; weighty, i.e. burdensome, grave.
Difficult to carry, oppressive. From dus- and a derivative of bastazo; oppressive.
A burden; the freight of a ship. Diminutive of phortos; an invoice, i.e. a task or service.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
The shoulder. Perhaps from the alternate of phero; the shoulder.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
A finger. Probably from deka; a finger.
To set in motion, move, remove, excite, stir up. From kio; to stir, literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
